global.translation[0].definitions[0].def: affecting or including the whole world
global.translation[0].definitions[1].def: considering all the parts of a problem or situation together
global.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: We are taking a global view of our business.
global.translation[0].definitions[2].def: affecting a whole computer system, program, or file
global.translation[1].definitions[0].def: including and considering all the parts of a situation together, rather than the individual parts separately
global.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The auditor’s report takes a global view of the figures.
global.translation[1].definitions[1].def: affecting or involving the whole world
global.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Information and money are becoming increasingly global.
Global banks must be able to serve the financing needs of corporations, big and small, anywhere in the world.
We need to reduce operating costs in the face of increased global competition.
The US competes in a global market and can’t ignore interest rates in other countries.
global.translation[1].definitions[2].def: if a company or industry goes global, it starts doing business all over the world
global.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The design agency went global in the 90s and today deals with all the Japanese, German and U.S. car makers.
